meanings.definition: The land along the edge of a lake.
meanings.sent1: Families enjoyed picnics by the lakeshore.
meanings.sent2: The cabin was nestled on the peaceful lakeshore.
meanings.sent3: The ducks waddled along the lakeshore, looking for snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered like a boat drifting along the lakeshore.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the lakeshore in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To move or be moved to the lakeshore.
meanings.sent1: We will lakeshore our belongings before setting up camp.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen lakeshored their boats after a long day on the water.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they lakeshored their sandcastles closer to the water.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day lakeshored into his mind, never to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The waves gently lakeshored the driftwood onto the sandy beach.
